info.author: ModuleLIFT
info.description:
[![GitHub issues](https://img.shields.io/github/issues/ModuleLIFT/aiomodulelift)](https://github.com/ModuleLIFT/aiomodulelift/issues)
[![GitHub license](https://img.shields.io/github/license/ModuleLIFT/aiomodulelift)](https://github.com/ModuleLIFT/aiomodulelift/blob/master/LICENSE)
[![Actions Status](https://github.com/ModuleLIFT/aiomodulelift/workflows/Python%20application/badge.svg)](https://github.com/ModuleLIFT/aiomodulelift/actions)

[Wrapper for ModuleLIFT's API](https://github.com/ModuleLIFT/API)

## Install
- Pypi: ``pip3 install aiomodulelift``
- Git: ``pip3 install git+https://github.com/ModuleLIFT/aiomodulelift.git``

## API
Every response aside from GraphQL returns [this](https://github.com/ModuleLIFT/aiomodulelift/blob/master/aiomodulelift/utils/response.py#L1) response object.

##### aiomodulelift.client(api_key, route, session=None)
- If you aren't passing a ``aiohttp.ClientSession`` object created within the event loop ``aiomodulelift.client`` should be ran within the context of the loop.

##### aiomodulelift.client(...).league(self, league_id, region)
- details(self)
- update(self, **kwargs)
- match(self, match_id=None)

    Object for interacting with a match.
    - end(self)
    - get(self)
    - scoreboard(self)
    - clone(self)
    - create(self, players: dict, maps: dict, team_names: dict)
    - select_player(self, user_id)
    - select_map(self, map_id)
- player(self, user_id)
    - get(self)
    - delete(self)
    - reset(self)
- players(self, user_ids)
    - fetch(self, include_stats=False)
    - validate(self)
- list(self, limit=25, offset=0, search="", desc=True)
    - matches(self)
    - players(self)
- graphql(self, query)

    Simple GraphQL client for sending requests to the API.

## Example
```py
import aiomodulelift
import asyncio


async def example():
    ml = aiomodulelift.client(
        api_key="******",
        route="http://example.com/api"
    )

    current_league = ml.league(league_id="tl", region="nz")

    get_match = current_league.match(match_id="7649058e-c854-4b2d-8810-8f372f12f2d6")

    scoreboard = await get_match.scoreboard()

    if not scoreboard.error:
        print(scoreboard.data)

    await ml.session.close()

loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
loop.run_until_complete(example())
loop.close()
```
info.name: aiomodulelift
info.summary: Awaiting Python Wrapper for ModuleLIFT API.
info.html_description:
Wrapper for ModuleLIFT's API

Install

  • Pypi: pip3 install aiomodulelift
  • Git: pip3 install git+https://github.com/ModuleLIFT/aiomodulelift.git

API

Every response aside from GraphQL returns this response object.

aiomodulelift.client(api_key, route, session=None)
  • If you aren't passing a aiohttp.ClientSession object created within the event loop aiomodulelift.client should be ran within the context of the loop.
aiomodulelift.client(...).league(self, league_id, region)

  • details(self)

  • update(self, **kwargs)

  • match(self, match_id=None)

  • graphql(self, query)

    Simple GraphQL client for sending requests to the API.

Example

import aiomodulelift
import asyncio


async def example():
    ml = aiomodulelift.client(
        api_key="******",
        route="http://example.com/api"
    )

    current_league = ml.league(league_id="tl", region="nz")

    get_match = current_league.match(match_id="7649058e-c854-4b2d-8810-8f372f12f2d6")

    scoreboard = await get_match.scoreboard()

    if not scoreboard.error:
        print(scoreboard.data)

    await ml.session.close()

loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
loop.run_until_complete(example())
loop.close()
